sections.title: First sentences: **BE** as the sentence engine
Core modality: ability, permission, obligation, advice
Noun system upgrade: countability, quantifiers, articles deeper
The Perfect aspect: experience, result, duration
Non-finite forms deep: infinitives, gerunds, participles

chapters.title: Subject / verb / object in practice (no heavy terminology)
Verb forms: V1 / V2 / V3 — what they are and why they matter
Sentence modes: statement → question → negative (as "switches" of one idea)
Personal pronouns + am/is/are (I am, you are…)
Statements with be: identity / description / location (I'm a student. She's at home.)
Questions with be: Are you…? What is…? (+ short answers)
Negatives with be: not, isn’t/aren’t
**a/an** as “one of many”: This is a book
This/that/these/those + here/there (pointing)
Adjectives after be: She is tired / It is important
Build & speak: mini-dialogues (introducing yourself + describing + clarifying)
Singular/plural: -s + basic irregulars (children, men…)
**There is/are**: existence + questions + negatives
**some/any** (starter level): there is some…, are there any…?
Possessive adjectives: my/your/his/her/our/their
Possessive 's: Anna's phone (and when **of** is better)
Object pronouns: me/him/them (I like **him**)
How many / How much (intro)
Build & speak: describe a room/bag/shopping list (there is/are + some/any + my)
Verbs as actions: base form + **-s** (he/she/it)
Present Simple statements: I work / She works
Questions with **do/does**: Do you…? What do you…?
Negatives: don't/doesn't + never (carefully)
Word order in questions (where the subject goes)
Frequency adverbs: always/often/sometimes/never — placement
Imperatives: Open… / Don’t open… + Let’s…
Build & speak: “my day / my routine / my habits”
Form: am/is/are + V-ing (spelling rules)
Meanings: right now / temporary / around this period
Simple vs Continuous: clear decision rules
Stative verbs: know/like/believe… (+ common exceptions)
Always in Continuous: complaining/annoyance meaning
Build & speak: “what’s happening now” vs “what I usually do”
Past of be: was/were + questions + negatives
Regular verbs: V2 (-ed) + basic spelling/pronunciation
Irregular verbs: how to learn/use them (not just list-memorizing)
Questions with **did**: Did you…? Where did you…?
Negatives: didn’t + V1
Time markers: yesterday/last…/…ago/in 2020
Used to (past habits) as an upgrade
Build & speak: a short story (6–10 sentences)
Form: was/were + V-ing
Past Simple vs Past Continuous in stories
when/while/as in the past
Two parallel actions: while I was…, she was…
Build & speak: a story with background + interruption
**will**: instant decisions, promises, offers, predictions
**be going to**: intention/plan, evidence-based prediction
Present Continuous for arrangements (I’m meeting…)
Time clauses: when/after/as soon as — **no will** in the time clause
Build & speak: weekend plans + predictions + arrangements
can/can’t: ability/permission/possibility
could: polite requests, “could you…?”
must vs have to: obligation (meaning difference)
mustn’t vs don’t have to: prohibition vs “not necessary”
should: advice/expectation
may/might (light intro): probability
Build & speak: house/work rules + requests + advice
Countable vs uncountable (money, advice, information…)
much/many/a lot of; few/little; a few/a little (meaning differences)
some/any in offers/requests (Would you like some…?)
**the**: shared knowledge / specific reference (“we both know which one”)
Zero article: plurals/abstract nouns in general statements
Special cases (geography, institutions, “school vs the school”)
Agreement pain points: each/every, none, police, news, etc.
Build & speak: shopping/food/plans with correct articles + quantifiers
Adjective position: a nice place / the place is nice
Adjective order (simple → full rule)
Comparatives/superlatives + irregulars (better/best…)
as…as / not as…as / the…the…
Adverb placement (frequency/manner/degree)
-ed vs -ing adjectives (bored/boring)
Gradable vs non-gradable (very vs absolutely)
Build & speak: review a movie/product/place (description + comparison)
Time prepositions: at/in/on; by/until; during/for (without Perfect yet)
Place prepositions: at/in/on; next to/between/among
Movement: to/into, across/through, out of/off
Verb + preposition: look for, depend on, listen to…
Adjective + preposition: afraid of, good at, interested in…
Phrasal verbs as grammar: separable/inseparable (pick it up)
Build & speak: directions + location + what you’re looking for
and/but/or/so: coordination + basic punctuation
because/so; although/but; while/whereas (contrast)
Time clauses again: when/before/after/as soon as
Noun clauses: I think (that)… / I don’t know if…
Indirect questions: Could you tell me…? (word order!)
Relative clauses (defining): who/which/that
Relative clauses (non-defining): commas, which/who, whose
Build & write: a 120–180 word text using connectors + 2 relative clauses
Present Perfect form: have/has + V3
Result: I’ve lost my keys (result matters now)
Experience: Have you ever…? never/before; been vs gone
Duration: for/since; How long…? (link to now)
Present Perfect vs Past Simple: decision rules
Past Perfect: “past before another past”
(Optional B2) Future Perfect / Future Continuous as expansion
Build & speak: biography/experience + a story with a flashback
Passive basics: be + V3 (when and why)
Passive across tenses (present/past/perfect)
by-agent: when to include it / omit it
Get-passive: “it happened to me” nuance
Causative: have/get something done
Impersonal passive: It is said that… / He is believed to…
Build & write: news/processes/services (passive + causative)
Zero conditional (general truths)
First conditional (real future)
Second conditional (unreal present/future)
Third conditional (unreal past)
Mixed conditionals
unless/provided/as long as
wish / if only / would rather / it’s time
Build & speak: advice + regrets + alternative scenarios
Gerund vs infinitive: basic choice (like doing / want to do)
Verb patterns: V-ing only / to-inf only / both (meaning changes)
Perfect infinitive/gerund: to have done / having done
Participle clauses: Having finished…, Seen from…, Generally speaking…
Dangling participles: common mistake + fixes
Build & write: a short formal text with 4 non-finite constructions
Reported statements: say/tell, backshift (basics)
Reported questions: word order + if/whether
Reported commands/requests: told me to…, asked me to…
Reporting verbs: advise/suggest/insist + patterns
Build & write: retell a conversation/news/instructions
Emphasis: do-emphasis (I *do* agree)
Inversion: Never have I…, Not only…, Hardly…when…
Cleft sentences: It’s X that…, What I need is…
Ellipsis/substitution: so/neither, do/does, one/ones
Hedging & stance: might, tends to, appears to…
Formal vs informal: contractions, linking, tone control
Build & write: rewrite neutral → formal (style transformation)
